body_html:
test failing on OSX:

16:09:04 ======================================================================
16:09:04 ERROR: test_matmul_4d_1d (__main__.TestAutograd)
16:09:04 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
16:09:04 Traceback (most recent call last):
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 3091, in do_test
16:09:04     check(name)
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 3023, in check
16:09:04     output_variable, (self_variable,) + args_variable)
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 2956, in run_grad_and_gradgrad_checks
16:09:04     test_case.assertTrue(gradgradcheck(apply_method, input_variables, gen_non_contig_grad_outputs=True))
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 265, in gradgradcheck
16:09:04     return gradcheck(new_func, inputs + grad_outputs, eps, atol, rtol, raise_exception)
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 186, in gradcheck
16:09:04     return fail_test('not reentrant')
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 166, in fail_test
16:09:04     raise RuntimeError(msg)
16:09:04 RuntimeError: not reentrant
16:09:04

It should be unrelated failure afaik, but @ezyang is the re-entrancy check a flaky test?

body:
test failing on OSX:

```
16:09:04 ======================================================================
16:09:04 ERROR: test_matmul_4d_1d (__main__.TestAutograd)
16:09:04 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
16:09:04 Traceback (most recent call last):
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 3091, in do_test
16:09:04     check(name)
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 3023, in check
16:09:04     output_variable, (self_variable,) + args_variable)
16:09:04   File "test_autograd.py", line 2956, in run_grad_and_gradgrad_checks
16:09:04     test_case.assertTrue(gradgradcheck(apply_method, input_variables, gen_non_contig_grad_outputs=True))
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 265, in gradgradcheck
16:09:04     return gradcheck(new_func, inputs + grad_outputs, eps, atol, rtol, raise_exception)
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 186, in gradcheck
16:09:04     return fail_test('not reentrant')
16:09:04   File "/private/var/lib/jenkins/workspace/pytorch-builds/pytorch-macos-10.13-py3-build-test/miniconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/autograd/gradcheck.py", line 166, in fail_test
16:09:04     raise RuntimeError(msg)

16:09:04 
```

It should be unrelated failure afaik, but @ezyang is the re-entrancy check a flaky test?
